submission:
class Solution:
    def minimumCost(self, m: int, n: int, horizontalCut: List[int], verticalCut: List[int]) -> int:
        horizontalCut.sort(reverse = True)
        verticalCut.sort(reverse = True)
        h_pieces = 1
        v_pieces = 1
        x = 0
        y = 0
        cost = 0
        
        while x < m - 1 and y < n - 1:
            if horizontalCut[x] > verticalCut[y]:
                cost = cost + (horizontalCut[x] * v_pieces)
                h_pieces += 1
                x += 1
            else:
                cost = cost + (verticalCut[y] * h_pieces)
                v_pieces += 1
                y += 1
 
        leftover_h = 0
        while x < m - 1:
            leftover_h += horizontalCut[x]
            x += 1
        cost += leftover_h * v_pieces
    
        leftover_v = 0
        while y < n - 1:
            leftover_v += verticalCut[y]
            y += 1
        cost += leftover_v * h_pieces
    
        return cost
